intro: Alchornea iricurana f. villosula, commonly known as the hairy alchornea, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland areas and thrives in shaded environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The species is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
